One of our users has trouble starting our eclipse based product because of this
problem.  What is the status of this pr?

This fell off the cliff for a while.  For Font.getFontData() to answer null it 
must be getting a font string from the OS that it cannot resolve.  Since we 
can't reproduce this, it's not clear why this is happening.  Questions for 
anyone that's CC'd and sees this problem:

- None of the reports that are duplicates of this one specify 3.0 as the 
version.  Does this still happen with a 3.0 stream eclipse?
- What font string(s) are we being given?  Compile and run the snippet at 
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/attachment.cgi?id=2294&action=view and paste the 
result here.
- Does https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=19209#c4 or 
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=19209#c9 help?
- Does it help to xrdb a file containing the following before launching eclipse:

Eclipse*fontList: -b&h-lucida sans-medium-r-normal-sans-12-120-72-72-p-71-
iso8859-1:

Thank you!!!  I got it to work...

In Reflection X Client Manager, Settings | Fonts, change "sub directories and
font servers" to:

100dpi 75dpi misc hp sun ibm dec

Then reconnect to your solaris host and you will be able to start eclipse. Each
user of Reflection X must do this setting in order to use eclipse through xterm.

This allows the X client manager to find the correct fonts for the workbench.
